title: I need reading aptitude test materials
content:
I need materials for a reading comprehension test I am running. The criteria are as follows:

1. 16 seperate pages at aproximately 700 words per page.  
2. University reading level  
3. The same source  
4. English as a first language.

Can anyone recommend a source?

 [‹ OT - new job assistance from sensible, or not so-sensible Typohiles](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203162739/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38786 "Go to previous forum topic") [Well-written outsider article ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203162739/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38805 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Christopher Dean

comments.content:
In a general sense, you could define irony as the incongruity between expectations and outcomes, specifically when the outcome reflects the incongruity in a painful or poignant way. When one’s actions achieve the opposite of one’s intentions, the incongruity is unavoidable. You feel like the forces of nature have conspired against you.

Try this : [http://owl.english.purdue.edu/handouts/esl/eslself.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203162739/http:/owl.english.purdue.edu/handouts/esl/eslself.html "http://owl.english.purdue.edu/handouts/esl/eslself.html")
